nodes.html: Once a given dataset has been publicly released it is accessible to all PRIDE users. The corresponding files can be downloaded from PRIDE using multiple mechanisms:

nodes.html: • 2) FTP download: Data files can be downloaded using the FTP protocol. Each dataset directory is accessible via a unique URL (e.g. ftp://ftp.pride.ebi.ac.uk/pride/data/archive/2012/03/PXD000001/).

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 14.66

nodes.html: • 3) Aspera download: Data files can also be downloaded using the Aspera file transfer protocol. Each dataset directory is accessible via a unique URL.

nodes.html: The most common way to download files is using the HTTPS protocol. In the dataset page one can find the Project FTP link. This link will take users to the dataset folder in the FTP server. Also, one will find the FTP for each file in the dataset page.

any.message: Element has sufficient color contrast of 14.66

Element has sufficient color contrast of 14.66

nodes.html: Different tools can be used to download files using the HTTPS protocol. For example, one can use the wget command line tool to download files.

nodes.html: The other most common way and/or easiest way to download files in bulk is using FTP clients.

nodes.html: Concerning FTP client programs, we recommend using WinSCP (Windows only) or FileZilla (for all OS). One can download one of them from these links:

nodes.html: • Mac: On the desktop go to cd ~/Applications/Aspera\ Connect.app/Contents/Resources/ there one will see the command line utilities where one is going to use ascp.

nodes.html: • Windows: The downloaded files are a bit hidden. For instance in Windows 7 the ascp.exe is located in the users home directory in: AppData\Local\Programs\Aspera\Aspera Connect\bin\ascp.exe.

nodes.html: • 2) FTP download: Data files can be downloaded using the FTP protocol. Each dataset directory is accessible via a unique URL (e.g. ftp://ftp.pride.ebi.ac.uk/pride/data/archive/2012/03/PXD000001/).

any.message: List item has a <ul>, <ol> or role="list" parent element

nodes.html: • 3) Aspera download: Data files can also be downloaded using the Aspera file transfer protocol. Each dataset directory is accessible via a unique URL.

any.message: List item has a <ul>, <ol> or role="list" parent element
List item has a <ul>, <ol> or role="list" parent element
List item has a <ul>, <ol> or role="list" parent element
List item has a <ul>, <ol> or role="list" parent element

nodes.html: • Mac: On the desktop go to cd ~/Applications/Aspera\ Connect.app/Contents/Resources/ there one will see the command line utilities where one is going to use ascp.

any.message: List item has a <ul>, <ol> or role="list" parent element

nodes.html: • Windows: The downloaded files are a bit hidden. For instance in Windows 7 the ascp.exe is located in the users home directory in: AppData\Local\Programs\Aspera\Aspera Connect\bin\ascp.exe.

any.message: List item has a <ul>, <ol> or role="list" parent element

nodes.html: • Linux: It should be in the users home directory, cd /home/username/.aspera/connect/bin/. There one will see the command line utilities where one is going to use ascp.

nodes.html: • Benchmarking data downloads

nodes.html: Once a given dataset has been publicly released it is accessible to all PRIDE users. The corresponding files can be downloaded from PRIDE using multiple mechanisms:

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • 2) FTP download: Data files can be downloaded using the FTP protocol. Each dataset directory is accessible via a unique URL (e.g. ftp://ftp.pride.ebi.ac.uk/pride/data/archive/2012/03/PXD000001/).

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: • 3) Aspera download: Data files can also be downloaded using the Aspera file transfer protocol. Each dataset directory is accessible via a unique URL.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: The most common way to download files is using the HTTPS protocol. In the dataset page one can find the Project FTP link. This link will take users to the dataset folder in the FTP server. Also, one will find the FTP for each file in the dataset page.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: The structure of each Project FTP folder is as follows:

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: And the structure of each file is as follows:

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Different tools can be used to download files using the HTTPS protocol. For example, one can use the wget command line tool to download files.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: The other most common way and/or easiest way to download files in bulk is using FTP clients.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: Concerning FTP client programs, we recommend using WinSCP (Windows only) or FileZilla (for all OS). One can download one of them from these links:

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html:
Eg: One can download files through a web browser https://ftp.pride.ebi.ac.uk/pride/data/archive/2018/04/PXD005011/
or use FTP tools like FileZilla

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html:
#### FileZilla
Host:ftp.pride.ebi.ac.uk
Path: pride/data/archive/<year>/<month>/<accession>
Username can be empty or in somecases, one need to explicitly provide "anonymous" as the username.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: #### FileZilla Host:ftp.pride.ebi.ac.uk Path: pride/data/archive/<year>/<month>/<accession> Username can be empty or in somecases, one need to explicitly provide "anonymous" as the username.

any.message: All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks
All page content is contained by landmarks

nodes.html: The PRIDE Streaming API is a RESTful API that allows users to download data from PRIDE. The API only has one endpoint that can be used to download files. The endpoint is:
